explanation: The bug was that S = input().split() produced a list (with the whole string as a single element) instead of the game-result string, so S.count('T') and S.count('A') returned wrong values and S[-1] was the full string rather than the last character. I fixed that line to read the raw string (stripping trailing newline) with input().strip(), leaving the rest of the logic unchanged.
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
S = input().strip()

T_W = S.count('T')
A_W = S.count('A')
print("T" if T_W > A_W or T_W == A_W and S[-1] == "A" else "A")
